Text: [We see footage from the previous game.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I had a family once. A wife.

Speaker: Ioreth
Text: This is beautiful.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And a son. And I buried them along with everyone I ever knew. What has happened to me? Am I dead?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You are banished from death, cast adrift between the worlds of light and dark. We are bound together, Talion. My life and yours.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Who are you, wraith?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I shaped the history of Middle-earth. I crafted the Rings of Power.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Celebrimbor. Greatest smith of the Second Age. Sauron deceived you into making the rings. He tortured both you and your kin.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Perhaps that pain is what connects us.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I should have died with my family.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I thought you wanted revenge! But there is only one way to close the circle. To defeat Sauron.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The time has come for a new ring.

Speaker: PROLOGUE
Text: THE NEW RING

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: The world of Men is ending. I have seen it. I have felt it. In the fires of Mount Doom, a Ranger with a Wraith bound together in death crafted the one thing that could challenge the Dark Lord. A Ring of Power. But power can blind those who seek it, and even the strongest bound can be broken. The future I have seen CANNOT come to pass.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Celebrimbor...

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: Death calls to you again, Ranger. How do you answer?

Speaker: Ioreth
Text: Talion. This is beautiful... Where did you find it?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I still have a few friends left in Gondor. What's wrong, my love?

Speaker: Ioreth
Text: The past is the past. Nothing can be changed.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must leave this place. We can go. Now.

Speaker: Ioreth
Text: You're too late. We're already dead.

Speaker: Talion
Text: No, no, no!

Speaker: Celebrimbor's Voice
Text: Wake up Talion. Wake up Talion.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: The wraith calls to you. I call to you.
[Talion wakes up at the cave entrance.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Wraith! Where are you?

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: He calls your name. Talion... Talion... Talion...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Celebrimbor?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion. Talion.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I will find you.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: You’ve come far...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Need to keep quiet.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Come, Talion. Free me.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: These Orcs are preparing for war.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion. Talion.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: He waits, but for how long?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Celebrimbor. What has been done to you?

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: You've kept us waiting. A spider does not forfeit its prey, Ranger. Not unless prize is set before it. I called you here for a reason.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You will return him to me. Now.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: You are brave, for a man. But it is not your sword that will save him. How much are you willing to sacrifice? To suffer.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I have given up everything.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: Not everything. Not yet.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You want the Ring.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: You would give me the ring for the wraith.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And find myself beside him in your web.

Speaker: Dark Haired Woman
Text: I am Shelob and I deal only in truth. I wouldn’t give it up either.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Wait.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion… no...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Take your prize.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: I’m impressed, Ranger. He must mean something to you.  Go to your puppet before he dies.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You have doomed us, Talion. Her power was vast before and now you have given her mine. I poured my life force into that ring.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we must take it back. Shelob!
[He tries to attack, but Shelob easily stops him.]

Speaker: Shelob
Text: The war you came to fight is not here. The ring is lost. So look to Minas Ithil and the Dark Lord's armies that surround it. Look to the Palantir, Sauron will not stop until all of Middle-earth is dominated.

Speaker: Saruman
Text: The Palantir must be protected.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Minas Ithil. I must know if Shelob’s vision holds true.

Speaker: ACT I
Text: THE SIEGE OF MINAS ITHIL

Speaker: Talion
Text: The spider showed us the truth. Gondor’s last fortress in Mordor cannot fall.

Speaker: MIDDLE-EARTH
Text: SHADOW OF WAR

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Palantir is our concern. We must seize it before it falls into Sauron’s hands. With it, his armies will be unstoppable. The fate of the city matters not.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I will not let them be slaughtered like my brothers at the Black Gate. We need to do something. Taking out the Captains should buy the Gondorians some time.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And they could lead us to the Palantir. We must find a worm and make him talk.
[Talion attacks one of the orc captains.]

Speaker: Orc Captain
Text: It's called the Palantir and it's why we’re here. The city is just an obstacle between us and it. You find the Seeing Stone -- you bring it directly to me. This how we conquer the Middle-earth, lads.
[Suddenly, a short girl with brown hair enters the battle.]

Speaker: Girl
Text: For Gondor! You will die here, Orc!
[After defeating the orcs, Talion decides to talk to the girl.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Why are you out here alone?

Speaker: Girl
Text: My raiding party was trapped in the lower city overnight.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How many of you were there?

Speaker: Girl
Text: Not enough.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Minas Ithil still stands.

Speaker: Girl
Text: We’re about to lose the Middle City, Ranger. They'll be closing the gate if they haven't already. We need to get up there as fast as we can.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I'll be right behind you. Wait! What is your name?

Speaker: Girl
Text: Idril.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Talion.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Don't fall behind, Talion. We've lost enough Men today.
[We hear the sounds of the horn.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: Do you hear that, Ranger?! They're closing the gate!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then let’s cut a path up there!

Speaker: Idril
Text: Sergeant Tarandor’s going to need our help. Let's move!

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: We thought we were dead!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: I don’t know who you are, but thank you!

Speaker: Idril
Text: Quickly! Under the gate.

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: Get moving.
[Talion is not going to follow Idril.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: What are you doing?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I won't be long. Go.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Have the archers provide support.
[In the headquarters.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: We've lost the Middle City. We made them pay for every inch of ground, but they now hold it.

Speaker: General
Text: Then our fate will be decided here. Our inner wall is our strongest and we have double their archers.

Speaker: Idril
Text: We cannot match the Orcs for their numbers and ferocity.

Speaker: General
Text: Oh, our people have held back Sauron's forces before.

Speaker: Idril
Text: But some things were lost forever.

Speaker: General
Text: Yes. Of course they were. Go to the Great Hall. Secure the relics.

Speaker: Idril
Text: My place is here.

Speaker: General
Text: Make sure they are taken to Henneth Annun.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Is that an order?

Speaker: General
Text: You must understand. We must protect what is most precious  at all costs. Yes, that is an order.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Then I'll see it done. But I'll be back on the wall before the next assault.
[Idril leaves. Talion enters.]

Speaker: General
Text: A Ranger from the Black Gates? I hear you were all dead.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You heard the truth.

Speaker: General
Text: If you've come to fight for Minas Ithil, Ranger, report to Captain Baranor.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I've not come to join your army, General, but for the Palantir. And ifs safe-keeping.

Speaker: General
Text: Protect the city and the Palantir will be safe. However, our raiding parties are targeting enemy captain's in the lower city.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You wish to spread terror in their ranks.

Speaker: General
Text: Yes. It's about time they tasted fear.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: The Men are assembled, General.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We need to secure the Palantir now. The city is weak, and it will not hold for much longer.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We cannot leave the Gondorians to their fate. Castamir is right. By protecting the city, we protect the Palantir.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Look. The towers bear his mark. Those were my towers once. Now Sauron's corruption spreads beyond the borders of Mordor. He mocks me.

Speaker: Talion
Text: They give him sight.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Not without the Palantir.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We will dismantle his hold on Minas Ithil. We will shift the tide of war.
[Talion goes outside and examines the city.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: These Haedir are but dark imitations of the Palantir, but we can turn Sauron's low craft against him.

Speaker: Talion
Text: These towers can give us sight.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We will purify them and make them ours.  Echadon i-vorn! Here we see all that has been lost, and all that will be lost if his corruption is allowed to return. This city is built on the ruins of my kingdom, yet some things remain. Those are my Barrows, still hidden from Sauron's sight. There I will show you why we must retrieve my ring.
[Talion finds a small cave that only wraiths can enter. There Celebrimbor tells about his past life.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: In a bygone age, my army marched on Mordor. We buried our honored dead in barrows like this one. Our greatest warriors are presented here, protected by powerful magic. And we used all our arts to bring the virtues of the Elves with us as we marched.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And you had the one Ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Yes… and with it I forged an army. I led the charge against Sauron.
[We see Celebrimbor fighting Sauron’s hordes.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: When Sauron revealed his betrayal, I took up arms against him. In my wrath, I was determined to punish him for his treachery. The new Ring – our Ring – is not marred with his shadow. It is perfect.
[Next scene. Baranor and Idril takes out valuables in a chest.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: There's no time. We can only take the most valuable.

Speaker: Idril
Text: We’re taking everything.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Idril, sacrifices must be made.

Speaker: Idril
Text: I will not sacrifice our past to fear.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Ho these. Who are you?

Speaker: Idril
Text: Baranor, this is the Ranger I was telling you about.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: You've spilled much blood for Minas Ithil. We don’t even know your name.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Talion.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Gondor thanks you, Talion. But we need all warriors at the gate.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The Uruks seek the Palantir and they will not stop until it is theirs. Where is it?

Speaker: Idril
Text: My father has hidden it.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: There is nothing safe, hidden or otherwise.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The Uruks will tear this city apart to find it.

Speaker: Idril
Text: These are desperate times, but we will not surrender. And we will not fall. We cannot --
[They hear explosions and run outside.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I must defend the gate.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: To the gates! Quickly!

Speaker: Talion
Text: I will not let this city fall!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Then we must obtain the Palantir, it is the only way.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Incoming!

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Form a skirmish line here, do not let any of them through!

Speaker: Idril
Text: I'll cover your flank!

Speaker: Baranor
Text: And I’ll cover yours!

Speaker: Idril
Text: You will never take the city! Stand together! For Gondor! That only the beginning, there'll be more! We have to find out what we're dealing with, this way!

Speaker: Talion
Text: The city can't take much more, I'll handle the Siege Beasts.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Baranor and I can manage here.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion, we must commandeer one of the Siege Beasts.

Speaker: Talion
Text: This should prove interesting.  Let's see what this thing can do.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Here they come.

Speaker: Orc
Text: Run, you fools! That dumb beast is shooting at us!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We’ve pushed them back. For now.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Another attack will surely follow. We should return to the upper city... check on Idril and the others.
[Next scene. Idril sits on the steps holding a broken statue in her hands.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: It's not enough for them to destroy us. They wish to wipe away our history.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: At least they don't have the Seeing Stone.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The gates are holding.

Speaker: Idril
Text: These relics were my life. My father was right… We must salvage what we can and leave.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You have a valuable weapon. The Seeing tone gives you sight over your enemy. Use it.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: It is too dangerous. The Palantir is poison to men. None can withstand its inﬂuence.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I can.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Men before you have thought the same.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And if I'm wrong, I will fail as they have failed. But if I’m right, we win this war.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Then I will find my father and speak to him.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: She will hold you to our oath, Ranger.
[Talion goes outside.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You put a lot of trust in her.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Give her time. Until then, we should return to Shelob. I need more answers.

Speaker: War Troll
Text: Umbri anai zadyash!
[Suddenly Gollum attacks the troll from behind and Talion kills it.]

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Oh, we saved you, Bright Master!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Gollum! And why would you save me?

Speaker: Gollum
Text: I wasn’t talking to you, stupid Ranger.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He is working for the spider.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: No… no… the Dark Mistress watches over Gollum. Gollum watches over the Bright Master. Bright Master kills the Dark Lord!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And the spider pulls the strings.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We share a common enemy in Sauron. And you can't always choose your allies. Lead on.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Come, Bright Master. Gollum will show you a quicksier path!

Speaker: Talion
Text: That wasn't just a troll.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They are Olog-Hai. War Trolls. They're smarter, faster, and immune to sunlight. Sauron's forces are more powerful than ever.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: We hates them as much as we hates nasty Orcses! We keeps our distance so we don’t get squished and crushed into bits.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Like how you tried to crush my head with a rock the last time I saw you?

Speaker: Gollum
Text: But we didn’t! We could never hurt the Bright Lord! We makes up for it now, yes?

Speaker: Talion
Text: That is yet to be seen.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Close, Bright Master! We're very close!
[Thay come to a cave there Shelob sits on throne and playing with spider.]

Speaker: Shelob
Text: I know why you are here.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Return what you stolen.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Silence, Ringmaker. You forget yourself. Stolen… He begged me to have it. And what of you, Talion?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’m here for Minas Ithil.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: You seek to save it… even though it may already be lost.

Speaker: Talion
Text: There must be a way. There is truth in your vision. Grant me another.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: To what end? For knowledge? To dominate? Oh, you don't have to tell me. Here is your truth.
[She shows him another vision. We see an orc sitting on a throne and speaks to someone.]

Speaker: Orc
Text: You want to move up the ranks? You got to kill. You wanna get noticed? Kill a pinkskin. The bigger the target, the higher you rise.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Idril. She dies.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Many will pass before Sauron is defeated.

Speaker: Talion
Text: This knowledge can guide our hand. If we kill this assassin, perhaps this future will not come to pass. She can be saved.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: She will live or die and it will not shift the tide of war. It is Castamir who must be protected. If he falls victim to this assassin, we will lose the Palantir.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: We'll find him, precious. For the Bright Lord. We go to Cirith Ungol. Yes, we'll find the nasty assassin.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The assassin must be stopped. Gollum, you know where to find him?

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Yes, we recognized his curved blade.

Speaker: Talion
Text: A Morgul Blade.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Yes. Stab, stab, stabbing, all the Warchief's bodyguards!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: If we find the Uruk bodyguards he's targeting, we'll find the Assassin.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: The first one is near. This way! You’re going the wrong way! Careful. We sees a Morgai Fly nest.

Speaker: Talion
Text: What are those Orcs doing?

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: You're afraid. Just like the Captain. Admit it!

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: I'm not afraid!

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: Then do it, stand under the nest.

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: Fine! I’ll show you I'm no coward. There! See? I’m not afraid, which is more than I can say for our fearless Captain.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: The first bodyguard should be this way. No, no, no, over here.
[Talion kills his first target.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Only a Morgul Blade could have caused these wounds. We're on the right track.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He's been dead for some time. We'll need to move faster if we want to catch up with the assassin.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Yes, we knows where another bodyguard is!

Speaker: Talion
Text: As the assassin kills his way up the hierarchy, he'll continue to seek bigger targets. Like Castamir.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Yes. Castamir is the only one who knows where the Palantir is. He must be kept alive at all costs.

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: The Warchief is useless. I wouldn't be surprised if The Dark Lord himself thanks me for killing the glob and taking his place. I'll do a much better job of taking -
[Talion exploit the Captain’s weakness – Morgai Flies.]

Speaker: Maku the Assassin
Text: Get them away from me!
[They cross blades.]

Speaker: Maku the Assassin
Text: I follow through with my orders, so if you're here to stop me, you'll be sorely disappointed.
[Talion kills Maku.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Let’s hope his death has changed what Shelob saw for Minas Ithil.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Minas Ithil will go the way of all flesh. We only need the Seeing Stone.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How much of your soul was lost in that ring?

Speaker: Gollum
Text: The Dark Mistress will be pleased. Oh yes, precious, she will...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Idril and Castamir should be safe for now.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: But the siege of Minas Ithil continues. The Palantir is still at risk of falling into enemy hands.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We are behind enemy lines. This is a perfect opportunity to sow chaos within Sauron's ranks. The assassin had one more target on his list. We should finish what we started and kill the Warchief’s final bodyguard.
[Talion finds Baranor preparing for assault.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: I almost feel sorry for the Warchief we're hunting. He'll be lonely without his bodyguards.

Speaker: Talion
Text: He'll join them soon enough.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Warchief Baranor seeks is just one of many, and they will continue their attacks on Minas Ithil.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then our path is clear, we have to kill them all. And we'll need help from the Gondorians to do it. Shelob’s visions will reveal our path.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must tread carefully, Talion.
[Back at Shelob’s cave.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You put too much faith in the spider. She only shows you what she wants.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Then tell me that you wish to see.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Minas Ithil still standing.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Always so selfless. Nothing more? We saw some troubling things last time, didn't we...

Speaker: Talion
Text: I want to know my fate with the Nazgûl.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Be careful what you ask for, Ranger. With prophecy comes torment.
[She shows him another vision. We see an army of orcs.]

Speaker: Warchief
Text: We take the city at dawn!

Speaker: The Witch-king
Text: Submit to your destiny.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I know that you fear, Talion. Shelob’s vision is not cast in stone.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The Witch-king.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Is it the power of Domination. The ring can enslave the minds of men.

Speaker: Talion
Text: What can be done?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Sacrifices must be made and many will be lost. But… we must hold to our purpose. No matter what the cost.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Lives can be saved. If the Warchief from my vision is the same one Baranor and his Men are hunting, they will need help.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: One Warchief makes little difference.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Right now this one Warchief is the most immediate threat to Minas Ithil. I will not stand by while Baranor and his Men risk their lives to take him down.
[Talion finds Baranor.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Baranor. I'm here to help. The Warchief you’re after is not one to be taken lightly.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: We've brought down Warchiefs before, Ranger. I won't turn down an extra sword.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we shall take him down then. I’ll take out his archers first. Your Men move in after I've cleared a path.
[He sneaks into the camp, quietly killing the archers.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We usually work alone. I hope the aim of these Gondorian archers is true otherwise we'll be dodging friendly arrows.

Speaker: Talion
Text: They're experienced soldiers, they'll do their part.
[He kill the Warchief.]

Speaker: Captain
Text: I'd say we're even.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: A good hunt. Less so for the Warchief.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And his archers. We should go hunting again.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: It would be my pleasure.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: So, Talion, did we make a difference?

Speaker: Talion
Text: We cannot see all ends. We must return to Shelob.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The only reason to go back is for my ring.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Enough! This is about more than your ring. Or you! Her sight may be what saves us all.
[He returns to Shelob.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’ve come to see more.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: I know.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You can see Sauron's fate, tell us his weakness. So we may defeat him.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Your vision is limited. I would love nothing more than to see his torment. To see him beg before me. But my gaze is fixed upon the fate of Middle-earth.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: When return that you have stolen from me, and I would bring Sauron to you in chains.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Why would I do that, Ringmaker? You and Sauron are one.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Is this what you seek? Vagaries and riddles? She is not our ally.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Certainly not yours. Come, Talion. See through my eyes.
[She touches his head and Talion sees another vision.]

Speaker: The Witch-king
Text: Their defeat comes from within.
[The vision ends.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Minas Ithil houses a traitor? But… who?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Do you doubt her?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Her visions have come to pass. You and I have both seen it.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Then Minas Ithil is fighting war on two sides.
[Talion goes back and suddenly meets Gollum.]

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Wait Bright Master! We knows how you can find the traitor.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Take us to him.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: A Warchief speaks to him through a messenger. We can shows you the messenger. Look there, do you see? The Dark Mistress offers her little ones. A nest, filled with her children. Wake them and sees what hey do! The little ones stings you, but doesn't kills you. Just a deep deep sleep. They will come back when no one sees and take the Orcses back to the Dark Mistress so she can gobbles them up!

Speaker: Talion
Text: A wretched fate.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: What brings terror to our enemies is valuable to us.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Come, the messenger is near. There, that's the messenger! Follow him and he will lead you to his master.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We'll take it from here. Stay fit of sight, Gollum.

Speaker: Messenger
Text: Out of the way. I'm on important business! Going to see the Man-Breaker. Just met with the traitor so I have valuable information for him.

Speaker: Orc
Text: I wasn't in your way. And if you've got such important business, why are you bothering to stop and brag about it to me? Get moving you maggot!
[Finally Talion sneaks into a Warchief’s fortress.]

Speaker: Messenger
Text: Man-Breaker! The Gravewalker is here, he's after me! I didn't tell him anything about the traitor. I swear!
[Warchief brutally kills him.]

Speaker: Warchief
Text: How many times have I told you all? Never speak of the traitor openly! Let this miserable dead glob be an example to the rest of you. The next maggot to even whisper the word "traitor" around me will get worse!  I suppose you're here because of the little turncoat I have in Minas Ithil. Well, you won't learn anything from me!
[Talion defeats and interrogates the Warchief.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will kneel!

Speaker: Warchief
Text: (in Witch-King’s voice) Your disruptions have not gone unnoticed, Ranger. You test my patience, soon I will test you.
[Talion kills the warchief.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: This is the work of Witch-King. He taunts us.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must my ring back.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And we will, but first we have to deal with the traitor within Minas Ithil.

Speaker: Gollum
Text: Talion, cruel Avenger, that bloodthirsty killer he guts all the Orcses, cuts off ugly headses he plays with their brainses, makes mince of their faces!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He has his uses.
[Talion returns to the walls of Minas Ithil. The orcs seem to be preparing a new attack.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: The Orcs' numbers have swelled beyond count.

Speaker: Man With Eyepatch
Text: They're preparing for another push.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: No one has seen your father since the last battle. I have men looking for him.
[One of the orcs climb up and look at the heroes.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: What new devilry is this?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Witch king himself comes to negotiate.
[The orc raises the dagger in his hand.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: My father’s blade!

Speaker: Witch-King
Text: My Orcs have your General. Send out the Ranger of the Black Gate to die at the hands of my champion and upon his defeat, your leader will be returned. Refuse, and all that is flesh shall suffer. I come for you Talion of Gondor.
[The orc melts in green flame.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: You understand...

Speaker: Idril
Text: That the Uruks are incapable of mercy? That my father may already be dead?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Ignore their taunts. We mustn't allow them--

Speaker: Idril
Text: The Uruks love spectacle. If we can distract them in the arena, we can sneak into their camp and find my father.  Can I ask this of you?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’ll give them a show to remember.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Try not to kill him too quickly.
[Talion enters the arena ready for battle.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They seem to like their Champions chances. And it must be said, he has size on his side.

Speaker: Talion
Text: True. But you and I have him outnumbered.

Speaker: Az-Tarmo the Blast
Text: They cheer for you. Cheer for blood.
[Talion defeats the champion.]

Speaker: Az-Tarmo the Blast
Text: I have failed the Dark Lord. But his designs are unaltered -- he has plans for your city. Manfilth, and plans indeed for you!
[Talion decapitates him.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You fought well ~- too well, Idril needs more time.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Should I dance for them?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Well, in a manner of speaking.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I came into this arena to fight Sauron's champion. I am still waiting!

Speaker: Rathak the Deathless
Text: Ranger! Crowd wants a show, and they're going to get one! And that show is called ‘Ranger getting torn to pieces by the toughest Uruk in Mordor!’
[Talion executes some captains.]

Speaker: Rash Firebelly (Nemesis)
Text: Come to this then, has it? Falls to me to do the job of offing this piece of Manfilth? With pleasure! You Maggot! Been a long time, Ranger. Last time I bloodied you was back in Udun, yeah? Well, this seems as good a place as any to end you good and proper. Come on, let's give the crowd a show!
[Talion pierces him with his sword.]

Speaker: Rash Firebelly (Nemesis)
Text: Good brawl in front of a cheering crowd? Can’t think of a better way to go.
[Talion cuts him in half.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I have upheld my end of the bargain. And your champion-- has upheld his! For fighting this pitiful enemy, the Dark Lord promised mercy. Gaze on the Bright Lord – I make no such offer!  Run! Run! Run to your master! And give him this message: I come for him!
Action: (spits on the ground, covered with bodies) (makes powerful blast of blue energy)

Text: [Talion goes back to Minas Ithil.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: My father is being held in the Warchief’s camp, but we were spotted before we could attempt a rescue. Baranor wants to wait till daybreak. Hit them with a small company.

Speaker: Talion
Text: But you want to go back now. Alone. That is the way to suicide.

Speaker: Idril
Text: If I wait till dawn, my father will be dead.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I'm not saying don't go. (takes out her father's dagger) I'm saying don't go alone.
[They leave the castle and walk through the forest.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: The Uruks we captured last winter told stories of a Gravewalker. Half Man, half wraith. A demon.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And what do you believe?

Speaker: Idril
Text: I believe we'd be lucky to have him. Baranor and I overheard the Uruk they took my father to a nearby encampment.

Speaker: Talion
Text: A gavel. Always seemed an odd symbol for justice.
[They find Castamir in one of the tents. He is talking to some orc.]

Speaker: Orc
Text: You're not going anywhere, General.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Father!
[Castamir swiftly kills the orc.]

Speaker: Castamir
Text: Oh, Idril! You should not have come here.

Speaker: Idril
Text: I came for you.

Speaker: Castamir
Text: This is not what I wanted. For you, for any of us.

Speaker: Idril
Text: There are things we don‘t get to choose.  But we can still fight.

Speaker: Castamir
Text: You are your mother's daughter. Come... The reinforcements will be arriving soon.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: What is "justice" if not a hammer to beat down the proud nail?

Speaker: Castamir
Text: Quickly, before more arrive.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Father... we...

Speaker: Castamir
Text: Quickly!
[They run to the castle. Baranor notices them standing on the wall.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: The General returns. Open the gate. Open the gate!

Speaker: Talion
Text: General. The Seeing Stone. I can use it to--

Speaker: Castamir
Text: The Palantir is safe where it is. The armies of Gondor will come soon.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: You're safe. Good.  Come...

Speaker: Idril
Text: We’ve been waiting for Gondor for weeks. No one has come. Can you really use the Stone to defeat them?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Then I will find where it's hidden.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must return to Shelob. She can show us the location of the Palantlr.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Palantir is here. The war is here. We must weaken Sauron's hold on Minas Ithil.
[Nevertheless, they're returning to Shelob's cave ...]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion…

Speaker: Talion
Text: The ring is lost, but I will have my answers… Shelob! Minas Ithil is on the verge of collapse. We need the Palantir.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: The Palantir. Have I not given you sight over your enemies? That is what you seek, isn't it? (looks into Talion's sorrowful eyes) Oh, I will grant you your vision. but how much are you willing to forfeit in the bargain? Your soul? There's hardly any left.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I must know.
[Shelob hugs him and gives him a new vision, from which Talion understands that Castamir is a traitor.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Castamir!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The final attack is coming. The Palantir cannot fall into Witch-king's hands.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must return in Minas Ithil.
[They run to the castle. Apparently, the preparation for a large-scale battle has already begun.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: They're moving up to the lower city.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Where are the archers?! I want every man with a bow up on the wall now.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: General Castamir pulled us off. We're to be held in reserve.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Why would he do that? We're beyond reserves.
[Talion walks up to him.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Where is Castamir? I need to find him.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: As do I. He hasn't been seen in hours. That sound.
[A huge ball of green flame shoots from the clouds of smoke on the mountain.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: The gate… Get down!
[The ball burns many soldiers, including the one with eyepatch. Everything happened as in the Shelob’s vision.]

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: They're burning!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Get water. Run!
[The Witch-King himself arrives on a Drake to watch what is happening on the battlefield.]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Form up! Shields! Hold them back! Now – attack! Push them back!
[They burn a Warchief to death.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: The city is lost! Save your people!

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Retreat! The city is lost!
[Meanwhile inside the castle...]

Speaker: Idril
Text: You betrayed us.

Speaker: Castamir
Text: I did this for you, Idril! For your survival. The Palantir means nothing! I would give all of Gondor to save you.

Speaker: Idril
Text: What of our people! Of our honor?

Speaker: Castamir
Text: There is no honor in death.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Castamir!
[The Witch-king appears in the clouds of green energy.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: You will deliver what was promised.
[Talion runs to him, but he is stopped by three Nazgûls.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: You will hold to our bargain. My daughter‘s freedom...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Castamir. No!

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: She is free to die with her people.
[He kills Castamir with one sweep of his mace.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: Father! (screams]
[She tries to chase after the Witch-king, but Talion stops her.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Idril! Leave. Now.
[He turns around and faces five Nazgûl.]

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Serve the Witch-king for eternity!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Return to darkness!
[Defeating the Nazgûl Talion finds the Witch-king standing on the wall and watching the battle. He turns around and stops Talion with a forceful flow.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: Submit to your destiny.
[Talion gets on his knees before him and was already preparing to die, when suddenly some elf in black clothes attacks the Witch-king from above.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: (to Nazgûl) Bring him to me.

Speaker: Elf
Text: Get up, Ranger! (to Nazgûl) You will not claim him today.
[Kills Talion with a dagger and leaves. The Witch-king sets the Palantir in its place and kneels before Sauron in his fair form as Annatar. Apparently, Shelob is also aware of the events.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: My Lord. I have the Palantir and we have located the New Ring. It is with the Spider...

Speaker: Annatar
Text: You have served me well. Minas Morgul is yours. Now bring me Celebrimbor’s ring.

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: And what of Shelob.

Speaker: Annatar
Text: Send the Nazgûl. All of them.
[Talion wakes up in some ruins.]

Speaker: Elf
Text: So it is true.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You killed me.

Speaker: Elf
Text: And yet you live. What is that like? To die and live again. Do you feel pain? Do you suffer?

Speaker: Talion
Text: What of the city? Of the Palantir?

Speaker: Elf
Text: The Nazgûl have taken both. They belong to the Dark Lord now.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then I have failed.

Speaker: Elf
Text: Not if you keep fighting.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: She wields the light of Galadriel. We can recover the ring.

Speaker: Elf
Text: Your rings are the cause of all this, Elf Lord.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You can see him?

Speaker: Elf
Text: I see him.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Who are you?

Speaker: Elf
Text: I am the Blade of Galadriel.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Since when does Galadriel work with assassins?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Great threats make for unlikely alliances. You know this better than most.  Now tell me more about this ring.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We crafted it to defeat Sauron. But it was lost to the Great Spider, Shelob.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The Nazgûl will be drawn to the power of the ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We cannot let it fall into Sauron’s hands. The light of Galadriel. Give it to us.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Stay your hand. My light will protect us, but it will not leave my side.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must move quickly.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Try to keep up! Come, Ranger!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Even Shelob’s brood fear the Nazgûl.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Come on! Don't stop to fight! We must hurry!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: If the Nazgûl get my Ring from Shelob, all is lost!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Shelob has the power of the New Ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You need not remind me. But powerful though my Ring is, the Nazgûl wield rings of their own. Our only hope is the light of Galadriel.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: And it shall protect us -- but I shall be the one to wield it. You are wasting time!

Speaker: Talion
Text: We are nearly there.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Ready yourself... and do not stray far from my side.
[They enter Shelob Cave. She is already fighting the Nazgûl.]

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: The Dark Lord will claim his prize.

[Our heroes enter the cave and engage in battle with the Nazgûl. The Blade of Galadriel throws the Light of Galadriel like a grenade and all the Nazgûl disappear. Talion walks up to Shelob. She abruptly grabs his hand showing him another vision in which Talion defeats the Nazgûl and Sauron. She gives him the ring.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Why?

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Sacrifices must be made.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Why now?

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Take the ring. Build your army. Your path will be made clear.
[Talion puts a ring on his finger.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The Ringwraith has fled. Your must destroy this ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: It belongs to us.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Your legend holds true, Celebrimbor.

Speaker: Talion
Text: This ring is different. We can use it to defeat Sauron. I strike down men corrupted by these rings. Do not become one of them.

Speaker: Talion
Text: When the time comes, I will do what is needed.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Perhaps. Get as far from here as you can. The Ringwraiths will return. They always do. Our paths will cross again.
[Talion takes the advice and leaves to Nurnen.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Do you hear that sound?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: That is the forest of Carnán -- and now our concern. Talion… We need to build our army.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes. There. That encampment is full of warriors.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Our warriors.

Speaker: ACT II
Text: RISE TO POWER

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Our greatest assets are the power the Ring and stealth. lf possible we should remain undetected until we have tilted the odds in our favor. These archers will be more than just our weapons, they will be our eyes.
[Talion goes to the orc camp to dominates 10 archers.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Strong as these warriors are, they cannot resist my Ring. Already our army consumes that of the Dark Lord. They are powerless to resist. He will serve us well. Let us test our warriors! A promising start but this is only the beginning: we require more warriors. Stronger warriors.

Speaker: Orc
Text: Go, go. It hunts us!

Speaker: Talion
Text: What creature haunts this forest?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Oh. Carnán is no creature. She is nature itself.

Speaker: Talion
Text: She calls us.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion, we must move with great caution.
[Talion finds an orc entwined with roots.]

Speaker: Orc Entwined With Roots
Text: Uugh! End it. End me. Aah, not you. Have some mercy, Ranger. Don't leave me like this.

Speaker: Orc’s Memory
Text: She’s picking us off one by one!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Vat beasts come hundreds strong!

Speaker: Orc’s Memory
Text: Get out here and show yourself!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Pit to peak. Enslave-ed are rivers and trees.

Speaker: Orc’s Memory
Text: What's this?! No. No, no. Nooooo!

Speaker: Talion
Text: I take it this is the work of Carnán?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: This is the Forest of Carnán and she will protect it with the full power of nature.

Speaker: Talion
Text: This forest is possessed by death as much as life.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The two are bound together. That is Carnán.

Speaker: Orc Entwined With Roots 2
Text: You have no idea what you've walked into. You'll never make it out of here alive. Or dead. Or whatever you are!

Speaker: Orc’s Memory
Text: What is she? The caragors? The ghuls? She’s all of it.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Feed you will feed a thousand mouths.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Why do these beasts not attack us?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They hear her song. They are part of her as she is part of them. Yet they will defend. She is watching us.

Speaker: Talion
Text: No... she's drawing us in.

Speaker: Orc Entwined With Roots 3
Text: Cut me loose, Tark. We'll, we'll fight our way out and - and then settle our differences. In here... in here we're just food!

Speaker: Orc’s Memory
Text: I've found it. The tree. She's the tree!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Spirit of Carnán is tree and beast. Fang and claw. Root and spear!
[Talion sees a giant tree.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Well, that wasn't there before.
[Carnán takes physical form, turning into a kind of lion.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Change-ed and unlike, this fleshling. Where is your rot? Your buddings... Do you grow, do you wither? No. No, no. A lifeless beast are you. But no... For you die and die. Not lifeless but deathless. A flesh-haunted thing.
[Talion is reaching for his sword...]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion. We cannot defeat her.

Speaker: Talion
Text: What would you suggest I do?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Throw down your sword. And kneel.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I will not kneel to this… thing.
[Talion attacks and defeat Spirit of Carnán.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Tooth and claw will cure.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Keeper of the wild! Carnán!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Who do you call to?
[He has to fight with different forms of Carnán.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I take it this is also Nature?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: In all its fury.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Can you tell it to stop?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: One does not reason with the wind.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: We burn with you. And return will we. Die alone we? Nature's tomb spanned sky and sea. We all die together.
[Talion defeats all the forms of Carnán.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: It seems this Carnán isn't as powerful-- (some roots draggs him underground]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Unleashed to rise and rise again! In a hole go you!

Speaker: Talion
Text: What have we unleashed?

Speaker: Carnán
Text: The cry of the forests, the scream of the rivers.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Spirit of Carnán--

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Cease all cry and clamor! You have woken Tar Goroth, cracked and creviced until now. Eye-opened the Dark Lord-- he stokes its ﬂames.
[Carnán walks out of the shadows. She looks like giant living tree woman.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Forge cage like kindling for shattering fire to come. Burn you! Burn we! A fire for all it will be!

Speaker: Talion
Text: What have we awoken?

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Un-death. Ringmaker, your forge sings. A crack across the land -- fire woken by a cold metal ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We hear your call. Allow us to help--

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Yes, you will. You, a deathless beast. You, a flesh-haunted thing.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We will find Tar Goroth.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Go now. Your Balrog waits -- he rises in Doom shadow. Fight till death and rise again you will fight! Soon and soon. Undeath will defeat undeath.
[She leaves and Talion crawl out of the cave.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: It seems this ring has woken more than Sauron.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Yes, we must go to Gorgoroth and deal with this Balrog.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Orcs fight each other endlessly to climb the hierarchy.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Then we shall find the ones who rise to the top. They are who we want in our army.
[Two orcs fight for power on the arena like a true warriors.]

Speaker: Zunn the Shy
Text: I've had enough of your mouth, Brûz. So now I’m gonna to kill you for all these Orcs to see!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: I always said you were an optimist. Know what that is, mate? It's about sizing up a situation that's bloody impossible and saying “yeah, all right -- I'll have a go!” I'm exactly the same way.
[Brûz kills Zunn ripping his head off.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I like him.

Speaker: Orc
Text: Brûz killed the boss! Come on, lads, get him!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Yeah come on then! Never can have too many heads! Ripper moves, Ranger! Reckon you’re going to skewer me? That little sword’s good for a tickle maybe, but you're gonna need more than that to take me down! I think some of that splattered on me! I’ll punch through your eyeballs and reach down and tear out your lungs! Oh, you've got to show me how to do that!
[Talion defeats and dominates Brûz.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will submit! You serve the Bright Lord now.

Speaker: Brûz The Chopper
Text: Bright Lord. Dark Lord, same thing really. End result is me ripping spines out, which I like to do anyway, so either way is a win.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A fine addition to our army.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Name’s Brûz. From here on out, I will be your shadow. No one gets to you without my say so.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Don't worry about my enemies. They all follow eventually.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: You wanna plant your flag in Mordor, you'll need to do it deep. There's a fortress nearby. They say it's ruled by two-headed troll. Big as a mountain and deadly smart, which I guess he’d have to be given the two heads. You take him down, you send a message to Sauron. And get yourself some nice new digs as part of the bargain!

Speaker: Talion
Text: We’re not going to do this alone. Gather your troops.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Will do. Ooh, just make sure you let me pop his his head off, won't ya?
[Talion continue to make to dominate orcs captains.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: How you going Bright Lord? Well, see you're expanding already. Beauty. You know what you should do is make that bloke your bodyguard. Anyone looking to carve his way across Mordor needs a guard or two. I mean, I don't obviously. Ugh. If it ever got to the point where I needed a hand on the battlefield I’d cut my own throat. But you you should have some added muscle. No shame in it.
[Talion continue to make to dominate orcs captains.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Got yourself another hanger-on have you? You'll have a proper army in no time. But you gotta remember, an army needs orders to follow, and I ll tell you what's always a popular one: murder. Command that new follower of yours to gut some bugger you don't like and that'll free you up to gut somebody else at the same time. And remember to keep the target’s weaknesses in mind. If he’s terrified of fire, there’s nothing funnier than sending someone to clobber him with fire weapon. That’s proper music that is.
[Talion continue to make to dominate Orcs captains.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Bright Lord! That bloke you recruited is a sneaky Bastard, he'd make a top backstabber. What you want to do is to make him Bodyguard to a Warchief, so he can, well, stab him in the back. Course, no Warchief's going to take on a Bodyguard unless he's prayed himself, and the place to do that is in the fight pits. How does surviving a few rounds make you trustworthy? No idea, but it's a bloody good laugh. And you’d be a drongo to trust Orc anyway so it all works out. Go on, have a go.
[Talion begins preparing for the siege. He trains his orcs in the pit and prepares equipment.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Clean wounds, and they never unsheathed their weapons. This looks like Eltariel's work.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: She is indiscriminate. By the look of it, some of these would have made good followers.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must find her before she eliminates all our potential recruits. Though if she did, we’d have little need of an army...

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: If you were looking for Ringwraiths, you're too late. But before I engaged him he was speaking to an Orc who was... different than the others.

Speaker: Talion
Text: There are Worms nearby. Perhaps they can tell uswhat is going on.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: If we take them alive.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: You don't decide whom I let live, Ringmaker. You'd both do well to remember.
[Celebrimbor interrogates a worm.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Nazgûl have dealings with special Orcs, what are they?

Speaker: Worm
Text: They're called the Chosen. I don't know what they're chosen for!
[He goes back to Eltariel.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Were your messengers forthcoming?

Speaker: Talion
Text: The Witch king is using the Haedir to track the Ring.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They extend the Palantir’s reach. Orcs called The Chosen guard them.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then the enemy may hold the Palantir, but the Haedir themselves are vulnerable.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: So. We know their design.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And now we dismantle it.
[Talion with his army approaches the gates of the orc castle.]

Speaker: Overlord
Text: You should not have come. This fort stands strong. We will kill you all!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: My Black Speech is a little rusty -- actually I don’t known a single word; language is a pain in the arse -- but to hazard a guess, he said “You’re all gonna die. Horribly.” My kind of bloke.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’ll handle the Overlord. You focus on the defenders.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Define “focus.”
[Talion rises his sword.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Charge!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Leave it to me and I have this down quick as!
[The siege begins. Talion with his army captures victory points.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: I fancy this fort-capturing business! And once this one's yours, you'll need a new Overlord -- I'd like to throw my hat in that ring!

Speaker: Talion
Text: What have I unleashed.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: His potential is nearly unlimited.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Right-o, now I’ll snuff the Overlord for you.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Killing the Overlord will send a message throughout this region. That message comes from ME.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Right-o.
[Talion faces the Overlord.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: This fort belongs to the Bright Lord now.

Speaker: Small head (in helmet)
Text: Gah! Can't hear anything in this! I thought I recognized that voice!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Ratbag?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: So much to catch up on! Where do I start?

Speaker: Talion
Text: How about your death?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: What? You mean getting hit by The Hammer? Pff. That was a headache at most. I mean, you want to kill an Uruk, you got to take the head clean off -- does the job every time. Well, most of the time I think. I don't know, never really been sure about that.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Oh. I'm quite sure it's all the time. Allow me to demonstrate.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Brûz. Welcome.  The Man is a friend. The Olog, watch him, make sure he don't do anything suspicious. Like, you know, kill me.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How did you end up here?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Well I was captured by some slavers. Actually they weren't all slavers. Two were cannibals. One was a necromancer. Fun bunch. They captured this Olog. He was in rough shape. We were cage mates until I sprung us out of there. Olog jumps out, arms go a flying, and then here were are, the best of friends.

Speaker: Olog
Text: We are not friends. You saved my life.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Oh, right! I should tell them about the fort thing. Thank you for that. It's kind of a long story... Ranger killed the old Overlord, now it's ours.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Ranger?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Oh. Yeah! I named him after you!

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’m honored.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: It’s been nice catching up and all, but Bright Lord and me just came by to tell you that the fort is ours now.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Bright Lord? Well, you're welcome to it, Bright Lord! Me and Ranger are done with the Overlord game. It's a right pain. You got to feed your followers, train your followers. Make sure you don't get killed by your followers. Yeah, it's a right bother.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Well your worries are over, because now I'm Overlord.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: No. Uh-uh. No no no no. Not you! Anybody but you! Whatever you need, Ranger, me and Ranger have got you covered. Wait... Ranger, Ranger. It’s a little confusing, isn’t it? But the point is, Brûz cannot be Overlord!

Speaker: Olog
Text: I agree.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Well I'm not working for these two. I'll tell you that right now.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: That works out perfectly, cuz we got no current openings for halfwits!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Ignore these squabbling fools. They have their uses. But we must choose our Overlord with care.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You read my mind.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: (to Brûz) Maybe you haven't noticed, but I'm a mighty, vicious... Olog’s friend!
[Talion goes to the parapet and speak to his army. His words echoing through the castle.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: We fought and suffered. But still we stand. There is a power in Mordor: you! In the days ahead, we will fight other battles and claim other fortresses, but starting today Mordor belongs to you. Mordor belongs to the Bright Lord!
[He sticks his flag into the parapet and claim the castle.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Now we have a foothold in Mordor.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We should upgrade our defences before Sauron attempt to reclaim what he has lost.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And there are more fortresses to conquer... and the Palantir is back in Minas Morgul. We must choose our your next move carefully.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Almost forgot to tell you one last thing. Now that you have my fort, it'll eventually come under attack – which, you already know, since you attacked it once yourself. Nicely done, by the way. Thing is, you don't always need to be on the defense. You have scouts who can sniff out enemy forts so you can go on the attack yourself. You know what they say, the best defence is a good offense! And don't worry about running low on Orcs. If you ever need new recruits you can go talk to a glob hey call The Headhunter. He'll sort you out. Oh Shrakh. I forgot to fill Ranger's feeding bowl before I left. He's going to be cranky if don't get back! I'm coming Ranger!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Ah, the fight pits. You know, this is more than just a place to pop so Orcs' heads off although that is something I cannot recommend enough. But the fight pits are where you test your followers, see what happens when they have a go at some other geezer. They're always bringing tough Orcs to fight, and if your fella survives, he'll be stronger for the experience. If he snuffs it, well, the one who done him in has what it takes, so there's a potential new recruit. And however it shakes out, your boys will love watching the show. Nothing boosts morale up like bodies going down.
[Talion watches a fight in the pits.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: See? Wasn't that a good time? Grog was drunk, laughs were had, blood was shed, and grog was drunk. Ah, there's no fight like a pit fight.

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Your fight is folly, Ranger. You accomplish nothing! The Haedir belong to the Witch-king. He tracks you, and soon, he will dominate you!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Hurry! They must not reclaim the Haedir.

Speaker: Talion
Text: They will not. A caragor would help us cover ground more quickly... Once we have retaken these towers, we should find Eltariel. She must know what is happening.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: She could be watching us right how.

Speaker: Gund the Chosen
Text: This Haedir is not yours! I reclaim it for the Witch-king, for I am Chosen! An you are filth!
[Talion kills Gund.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Have you thought about why Eltariel was selected to be Galadriel's Blade?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I can't presume to know what is in an Elf's mind. Surely this Galadriel would send the best.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I don't question whether she is the best... only whether she is the first.

Speaker: Zugor the Chosen
Text: Those who trespass will suffer. The Witch-king demands, as he demands I reclaim this tower!
[Talion kills Zugor.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: These Chosen are tenacious indeed. The Nazgûl are wise to create such powerful servants.

Speaker: Talion
Text: However powerful the Chosen may be, the ritual to create them is where they will be weakest.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Indeed. When the final tower is ours, we should turn our attention to finding the ritual's location.

Speaker: Gubu the Chosen
Text: My mission is almost complete!That Haedir belongs to the Witch-king!
[Nazgûl enters.]

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: And so do you, Ranger! Join our ranks! Together we will serve the Witch-king!
[Talion defeats him along with his minions.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: With each tower we reclaim, the Witch-king's vision diminishes.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We will rob the Witch-king of more than his vision.
[Talion sees Blade of Galadriel.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: There is another Worm we must intercept.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And what message does he carry?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Orders for three Captains to report to the Chosen ritual. He'll pass rough this camp.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Well he's going to find it curiously empty.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Since your interrogations, the Worms move under guard I'll move to high ground to eliminate the escorts.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Not all of them.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: We'll see, Ranger.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Here they come!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Are you just seeing them now? This will be easier than I thought!
[They kill all the guards.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Here he comes we must learn what he knows.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Are you deciding whom I let live?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Just get the information.
[Talion interrogate the Worm.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Where are the Captains who would become Chosen?

Speaker: Worm
Text: They're coming from the fort! They should be here shortly.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Seems our friends are eager to meet us.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Good. Our ‘friendly’ competition is not over yet.

Speaker: Nazu the Reaper
Text: You! You will not stop me from being made Chosen! I am worthy. You are dead!

Speaker: Grom the Wicked
Text: This is the end for you! I will decorate the landscape with your insides!

Speaker: Mogg the Watcher
Text: We going to kill him, or what?
[Talion punishes them using fire and steel.]

Speaker: Nazu the Reaper
Text: I won't forget this, Ranger! You haven't seen the last of me!
[However, Talion manages to catch him up and rips his belly.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Well that's three Captains who will not become Chosen, but there is no shortage of recruits to take their place.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Any who are selected we will target. If we cannot yet to stop the Nazgûl, we will slow them down.
[Night. Talion walks down the street and realizes that someone is following him. He ambushes and catches the pursuer.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Ho there.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Baranor?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: You survived.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How did you find me?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: It was easy. I just followed the trail of dead Orcs.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And Idril. Did she escape Minas Ithil?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: We were ambushed. I lost her. Many of our brothers were captured. Some remain in hiding. Sauron's armies continue to hunt us.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Idril is resourceful, but no one survives in Mordor for long.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: We have a way out. I just need to find her... and whoever's left.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we must find them all.
[Talion going to save 3 Gondorians.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Some of our soldiers were sighted in this encampment.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Tread lightly. We must be careful.
[Baranor grabs his back.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Are you all right?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: I might need a moment.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You cannot delay. When you find Idril, escape to the West. Have a second chance at life.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: I've already lived two lives. I was born somewhere near Umbar. A Haradrim.

Speaker: Talion
Text: That is a long way from Minas Ithil.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: My Order sent me to Gondor as a guarantee of peace, but the Haradrim had other enemies. I was to return but by the time I was ten, we lost contact. I lived a good life in Minas Ithil. I was respected. I was happy. And then it fell.

Speaker: Talion
Text: So now you commence your third life.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: The only life that matters is the one with Idril. But we have to find her first.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And that we will.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: The Uruks use our soldiers as bait. Those are the lucky ones.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Have you managed to free many of your brothers?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Not enough. Some weeks, we lose as many as we rescue.
[They rescue a soldier.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: I am in your debt. Captain Baranor!

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Carros. Are there any others?

Speaker: Carros
Text: Idril. She's alive. We were on our way to the fighting pits when we were captured. She escaped. If I know Idril, that's where she's headed.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: She's alive. She's alive. I had not dared hope.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We will find her.
[Talion and Baranor finds an arena where the Gondorian soldiers fights the orcs.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: They make sport of our misery.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we will make misery of their sport.
[They save Idril.]

Speaker: Baranor
Text: I feared… I’ve search everywhere for you.

Speaker: Idril
Text: And I you.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Come. I will escort you to Henneth Annûn. You’ll be safe there.

Speaker: Idril
Text: No. I’m not leaving Mordor. Not ‘till all of our brothers are free.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Come now. We will speak of this later.

Speaker: Idril
Text: My father sacrificed all of Minas Ithil for my safety. I will not be protected any longer. Not by you… not by anyone.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Idril. You will die out here.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Then that is my fate. But I am staying. Go. Go, reinforcements will be here soon. We will meet again.
[Talion leaves.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: She's a true warrior. She fears nothing anymore.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes. That's the problem.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Idril will never leave Mordor. She’ll fight until she dies.

Speaker: Talion
Text: That’s what I am afraid of.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Feel like a bit of treasure hunting?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Every Ranger likes to hunt. What did you have in mind?

Speaker: Idril
Text: The Uruks can be relied on for certain things. Their love of blood, treasure, and grog. (poison the barrel of grog]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I see how you’ve survived so long in Mordor.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Our numbers keep us from engaging them on the battlefield so we work by stealth and speed, and hopefully we can escape with our lives.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And a few of theirs. You understand that Baranor fears for your life.

Speaker: Idril
Text: I fear nothing any more. I couldn't survive here if I did.

Speaker: Idril
Text: I'd say that was one of our more successful missions, Gravewalker.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I can hardly remember the scared young soldier I met in the lower city.

Speaker: Idril
Text: You mean the one that saved your life from that Captain?

Speaker: Talion
Text: That's the one.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Baranor.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: One of our scouts reported prisoners here. And far too many Orcs to handle alone. Let's each take a flank and meet in the middle.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I'll be there. And Baranor. You must be careful.
[Talion finds and frees prisoners, killing two captains along the way, arranging an ambush against him.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: At this time we attacked this Chosen problem at its source.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The closer we get the closer we come to facing their master.
[Talion sees the Nazgûl conduct a ritual over the three orcs...]

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Gilunai. Hukhag, tudgum snaga.

Speaker: Talion
Text: So that's how the chosen are created. I thought it would be more festive.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Nazgûl is entirely focused on the ritual. This is the perfect time to strike.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Archers cover the approach. It would be wise to eliminate them quietly.

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Welcome, Talion. Come to join these three in service to the Witch-king? For that is your destiny -- you must know this. We will never stop. Not with the Chosen, and not with you.

Speaker: Norsko Skull-Lopper
Text: I serve the Nazgûl, as they serve the Witch-king. As you will serve him!

Speaker: Nazu Scorcher
Text: They'll hear you scream clear to Gondor!

Speaker: Hura Cannibal
Text: This won't take long. Let's go!

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Submit to our master! The Witch-king cannot be denied.
[Talion dominates all the Chosen orcs.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Well fought. But this was not the last ritual, and it will not be the last fight.

Speaker: Talion
Text: So much death.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Death would be relief to these men. The purpose of this camp is torture.
[Talion rescues Baranor.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Are you able to fight?

Speaker: Baranor
Text: More than able.

Speaker: Az-Agur Dwarf-Hater
Text: Dwarf-lover… You know what I like about you, coming into a death trap alone like this? You’re consistent. Consistently stupid, maybe, but consistent.

Speaker: Narug Ghul Lover
Text: You should listen to him. It’s a matter of – not so much life and death – as death and death.

Speaker: Idril
Text: Stand, Men of the West!
[Talion defeats Az-Agur and Narug.]

Speaker: Az-Agur Dwarf-Hater
Text: I’d rather die than share the world with Dwarves!
[Talion cut off his arm and kills him.]

Speaker: Idril
Text: You're injured.

Speaker: Baranor
Text: It's nothing. You saved us. Again.

Speaker: Idril
Text: You were right. Staying in Mordor is certain doom, but I cannot leave.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: My lady...

Speaker: Baranor
Text: Then we'll be doomed together.
[Together with a handful of soldiers, they run into the depths of Gorgoroth.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The Nazgûl is holding some of your followers.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must recover them.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Such loyalty to the Orcs.

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Together we will serve the Witch-king! We knew you would come. Now, join your army -- in service to the Witch-king!
[But Talion have other plans. He attack the Nazgûl.]

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Your fall is inevitable!
[Some Captains arrives.]

Speaker: Ur-Lazu the Chosen
Text: Ranger-boy. I call my boys and they come for you. We all come for you.

Speaker: Ur-Benu the Chosen
Text: We attack now!

Speaker: Nazgûl
Text: Join us, brother! Fall before us and rise! Submit to our dark master! It is folly to resist! Yield! And rid yourself of this wraith! Submit, Ranger! We will purge this foul Elf from you!
[Talion kills Captains and defeat 2 Nazgûls. He frees his followers.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Our army remain strong. And we have all but assured the Nazgûl cannot track us.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: But they are still not defeated. And as long as they are out there, we are not safe. You least of all.
[Next Talion decides to siege Terror Fortress lv80.]

Speaker: Skûn the Merciless
Text: This is where the Uruks turn the tide! This fort will stand for the Dark Lord! Before you storm these walls, know this: before the day is out, you will be hung from them! Not dead, but living!

Speaker: Pâsh the Gab
Text: Now's the time to strike, boss! On your order, of course

Speaker: Thrak Skin-Chewer
Text: He gives a good speech. Guess he'd have to this being the last time it will happen.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Charge!
[The siege begins. Talion and his army captured 4 Victory Points and goes to the throne room.]

Speaker: Skûn the Merciless
Text: Those who dare stand before the lord of this fort are swiftly put to death.

Speaker: Talion
Text: That's right. And yet you're still here.
[Bloody fight, but Talion's getting the upper hand.]

Speaker: Skûn the Merciless
Text: It won't do you no good, Manfilth. My brothers'll take back this fort and chop you to pieces.
[Talion decapitates him and goes out to his warriors.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Victory is ours. Savor it! Sauron cowers before us. We have taken his fortresses and made them our own. Now, we stand at the very edge of history. Only one conquest remains and Mordor will be ours!
[Meanwhile in some hellish pits an orc shaman calls for an abyss.]

Speaker: Orc Shaman
Text: Tar Goroth! We call you to the shallows. Rise and join our glory. Rise and join the Shadows army. Come to us. Rise, rise, rise!
[A new target, Zog the Eternal appears on Talion’s path.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: What do they unearth?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They are summoning death. But it will be death for all.
[Talion kills 10 acolytes that summon Tar Goroth.]

Speaker: Acolyte
Text: Soon, you will know the meaning of fire. Sauron's army will be unstoppable.
[His target, Zog, is among the acolytes. Talion cross swords with him.]

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: What an honor to meet the most famous dead Man in Mordor. You really shook the world with that ring forging trick of yours. After that, Tar Goroth only needed a little coaxing. Now it rises to the surface. And it comes for you.
[Talion defeats him.]

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Don't be sad. It doesn't end here. I will wake all the dead of Mordor before we're done. All the lives you ended. And once they're risen, who do you think they'll come for? Oh yes, we'll meet again. Swallowed by the darkness!
[Talion finishes off all 10 Acolytes.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion. It has begun. The Balrog is rising.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We will not give it the chance.
[He jumps into the fiery pit.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Fools. No one can tame a Balrog.
[Tar Goroth has risen. He kills his summoners with a fire whip.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: This foe is beyond us, Celebrimbor.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Not with the spirit of Carnán at our side.
[The Spirit of Nature herself appears before them.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Woken by death's ring. Flames burn us! You woke him! You woke him!
[Epic fight begins.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion. We must fire into its back!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Back to pitted sleep! We bury again. You trespass my dominion.

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Gaur. [Die!]
[He run from the battlefield.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Tar Goroth cannot escape. Leap, we must leap!
[Talion jumps on Carnán's back and they follow Tar Goroth.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Argh. Tar Goroth devours us. It is revealed! Into the eye of his trunk you fire.
[Tar Goroth crushes Carnán's head like a watermelon and runs away again. Carnán turns into a bird and flies in the wake.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: No rest for you, no rest for we, Deathless One.

Speaker: Talion
Text: She is truly a power to be reckoned with.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The spirit of Carinhos witnessed Middle-earth's devastation and its revival many times over. She was here before any of us, and she will be here long after we have perished,
[Talion meets Carnán again in a snowy forest. She’s in the form of a bull.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Tar Goroth fouls earth and sky. Plows a path of flame! Haste haste haste.
[Talion sits on her back.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: It rages across lands. Scorches a path.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Tar Goroth will not be difficult to find.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Escap-ed is Tar Goroth. Flees Mordor to burn your lands. He must be buried, he must be returned to the depths. Burns, it burns all.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The tracks... No. It's doubled back!
[Tar Goroth appears.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Lies in wait to rain down fire!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Where are we going?

Speaker: Carnán
Text: To ice! We go to ice! Our beasts become cinder, fleshling! Take aim!

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Ghâshizik! [You will burn!]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Rain hail-swords upon the Flame! Fell this beast to rot and weed! Flee we flee!
[They're bringing Tar Goroth to the ice field. He uses his whip of fire knocks Talion down from Carnán. Epic battle continues.]

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Onguk nakhân. [Your end has come.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: What did he say?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Does it matter?

Speaker: Talion
Text: This Balrog is from another world.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: It is up to us, now Talion.
[Talion wins.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: We bring light to your abyss! An end to your fire!
[Talion sits on her back and the fight continues.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: This isn't working!

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Umbruk Gûm nash! [Your world is Void.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Now. We must attack.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Strike like thunder. Fall like rain. Drowned is his flame!

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Ghâsh-ishi umbruk ongizash! [Your world will end in fire!]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Dive now. We must send this beast to the depths.

Speaker: Tar Goroth
Text: Rogan gir’zikin! [You will never bury me again.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Now. We must attack.
[They're drowning the Tar Goroth in the icy water of the lake.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Undeath will defeat undeath.
[Having defeated Tar Goroth, Talion goes to the Carnán’s Cave. She seems to be exhausted by battle.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: You've sacrificed much.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Long afore. Buried was Tar Goroth by Carnán in Doom Shadow. Aghast my forest destroyed, my brood scattered. Now again find is buried. Drown-ed in ice. And from decay come bloom. The circle is unbroken.

Speaker: Talion
Text: There was an Uruk in Gorgoroth. This ‘Zog.’

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Chainer of Tar Goroth he. Death's midwife. Raise-ed Tar Goroth. Raise-ed Orclings.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A necromancer.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: He is near. Stains air with Orc magics. Cunning he, dwimmer-crafty. They rise like tidewaters. Baseborn, beset -- beset by death. They come for you.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: By my oath, we will find him, and honor your sacrifice.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Febrer the foul or return them to dust. Defile-ed is the land. Curse-ed is the maker.
[Talion leave the cave.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Haste. The death-talker is near. A tormented beast is he. Blade to flesh and be done!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A foul creature. All our work will be naught if Sauron can raise the dead.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Ths Zog cannot be far off.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: This Zog’s disease. Bring him to rot!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: There. We must purify the necromancer totems. Only then can we end the ritual. We must purge this blight.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Close and closer still.

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: We meet again. I am Zog, and I've been watching you for some time. You’re the inspiration for all this! What better army to defeat a dead Man than a legion of undead Orcs!

Speaker: Orc
Text: You will not disturb the ritual!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion, they will not stop rising until we drain the necromancer totem of its power!

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: They rise. You're not fighting us. Ranger, you're fighting the future! The dead will take Mordor for themselves and not even you can stop us! Ooh, there's more fun to come!
[He leaves.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We MUST drain the totem of its power!
[Talion drains the totem.]

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger. You got trouble.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Generally the case.
[Brûz grabs Ratbag by the neck.]

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Don't bother the boss with your nonsense, you little whinger.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Whinger?! Honestly Brûz, that hurts... OHHH that hurts even more!

Speaker: Talion
Text: What's the trouble?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: A broken rib, I think. But what I wanted to tell you is, the fort is being attacked! The Dark Lord knows you're here. And the door to my escape tunnel is jammed.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A test of our defences.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And our defenders. Brûz!

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Hmm?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Prepare to defend the fort.

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Oh that sounds like a job for Overlord whatshisname. Seeing as how I was passed over for that position.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You will do as you are told.

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Come on, Brightfella. I'm just having a laugh. You know how I love snapping off heads. I'll defend the fort like it was my own.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: I'll help with the defence as well! I'll start with the food in the pantry. Make sure it hasn't been poisoned.
[Talion kills the attackers at the gates and brand the captain.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Kneel before me!

Speaker: Flogg Blade Smith
Text: I will serve you. No harm will come to you!

Speaker: Ar-Janek Fear Monger
Text: Outsider! This fortress is the dominion of the Dark Lord! We will purge this place of traitors, and flay your Manflesh into a banner beneath which we will march to storm Gondor! Tremble before me!
[Talion defeats and brands him.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Serve the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Ar-Janek Fear Monger
Text: I am yours, Master! I stand with you, Bright Lord!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They are targeting the inner gate! If these Orcs reach the Keep...

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then that is where they will die.

Speaker: Orc
Text: Right-o.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Submit to me! You fight for the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Mâku Man-catcher
Text: I heed your voice, Bright Lord. It'll be a pleasure. He won't be getting up!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: On your knees!

Speaker: Orc
Text: Oh! Did you see that one, boss?
[Talion kill all the Captains that attacked his castle.]

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Reckon that's the last of them, boss.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Another attack will surely come.
