Speaker: Brûz
Text: I hope so. This one was a blast.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You fought very well.

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Told you I'd defend this fort like it was my own.
[He's stabbing Talion in the back.]

Speaker: Brûz
Text: Turns out, it is!
[He's dumping Talion's breathless body off the balcony.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Treason! We will retake our fortress. We will slaughter that wretched Olog and all who stand with him.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And what of the ones who stand with us? Clearly, their loyalty cannot be trusted.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: All who resist will be made an example of.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Brûz has not seen the end of us.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We cannot let his betrayal go unanswered.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Brûz will pay for his betrayal.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And it will be a warning to all who dare follow him.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger. You’ve got trouble. Brûz has taken over your fortress.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I figured that was the plan when he stabbed me in the back.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: From the back, right through to the front…  I mean you were like bleeding… (laughs]
[Talion looks at him without smiling.]

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Sorry, the point is the other Orcs know that you had Brûz with your “Suffer me now”. And Ans they know he broke free. Which has caused quite an impression, let me tell you. Orcs are lining up to follow him. Now. I'm not one to tell you how to do your business, but you need to put a stop to him right away. And you might want to mount a rescue.

Speaker: Talion
Text: A rescue?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Yeah, he’s taken over a bunch of prisoners. One of whom is your Overlord, I'm pretty sure -- you might want to save him?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Where.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: This way. I mean really, it was like you were stuck on a spic and just--

Speaker: Talion
Text: QUIET.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: There are three prisoners. You go in and do your thing. I'll stay back and scout the area. I'm a really good scout.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Scouts go on ahead.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: And die. That's why I'm so good. Right, here we are! Commence scouting.
[Talion is rescuing one of his captains…]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Thanks for coming for me... eventually.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: So far so good. There are two more prisoners.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes, you said three and we've got one. I can count.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Oh! Well that'll come in handy...

Speaker: Skûn the Gut Ripper
Text: Man Filth! Come to watch me work? I'm not surprised. I'm a bit of a legend in the execution game. I'll show you my skills--up close and very personal.
[Talion breaks and brands him.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Kneel before me! I am your master!

Speaker: Skûn the Gut Ripper
Text: I heed your voice, Bright Lord. Only if I can keep the guts.
[Talion is rescuing 2nd captain.]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Thanks for coming for me. That was really starting to hurt!

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: So up ahead is the last--well, you know you've been doin' the countin'.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes, I know.
[Talion is rescuing 3rd captain.]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Lead on, master.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Well, I guess that's it then! You can get back to your warmongering and, uh… oh, hello.
[He's starting to have fun picking the pockets of the dead Orcs. Talion puts a sword to his throat.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: We are not done here. Brûz?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Oh right. Brûz. In his fortress. Your fortress! Had a lot of owners, that fortress. Oh when the fortress was mine. It was a wee bit drafty but on the views! I mean... I made a lot of improvements to that place

Speaker: Talion
Text: Like your tunnel.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Yeah! I had an escape tunnel. Smart thinking. I thought. You know, great if you need to get out. That's for sure.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We could use that.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Why? We don't need to get out.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We could use it to get back in!

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Riggggghhht.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Where is this tunnel?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: This way. I'm pretty sure...

Speaker: Talion
Text: (sighs]
[They'll sneak through a secret tunnel and enter the throne room.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Welcome back. Boss. So what was the plan? Rescue your boys? Bring them here for some kind of reckoning? You brought along that little shrakh-stain Ratbag. Well tell you what? I've got some friends too, me! Yeah... We can have a real party--a right shindig, yeah? We can have some grog, play a few fun party games, like, oh uh... pull the arms off the Ranger! Have at 'im, boys!
[Talion strikes him with his sword a few times.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Such a bugger, Ranger! Wasn't supposed to go this way. But you'll see me again, sure as shrakh in a caragor!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He won't get far. We will find him and use him to show all of Mordor what happens to those who oppose the Bright Lord.

Speaker: Gruk the Gravewalker
Text: Pretender! My name is known at grave sites throughout Mordor. The dead rise when they hear my incantations. I EARNED the title of Gravewalker, and now you sully the in name by using it for yourself. This ends now.

Speaker: Mozû the Angry
Text: This is way too much talk!

Speaker: Ogg Slave Keeper
Text: Ranger! You stinkin’ Tarks are all alike. Weak, cowardly, and useless!

Speaker: Mozû the Angry
Text: I think it's time we stopped talking and started beating!
[Talion executes Brûz’s Captains and comes out onto the balcony.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: This fortress is once again under my command. An attempted rebellion has been put down. Its conspirators have been put to the sword Its leader will soon suffer the same fate! You now hold this fortress for the Bright Lord. Here my enemies will find no weakness, no mercy, only the unassailable strength of my army!

Speaker: Talion
Text: It appears Ratbag has need of us.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Hear him out, but do not let him distract you from our true mission,

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Talion! Ratbag needs your help. I've lost Ranger.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How do you lose an Olog?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: He was taken! I found this messenger by his food bowl. (pulls out the severed head]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Isn't there an expression about killing the messenger?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Yeah. ALWAYS kill the messenger.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Well, that actually explains a lot. So what did he have to say?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: He said, “If you ever want to see your pet again. Bring the Shrakh-eating Gravewalker-- (shakes the severed head]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Don't do that.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Oh, sorry.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You realize this is a trap.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Of course! But you owe me. And you owe Ranger! After all, we got rid of Brûz for you.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Not exactly how I remember it.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Well, we could quibble over details all day. But the fact is, we're your boys! What'll the other Orcs think if you don't stand up for one of your own?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He's right. Orcs follow strength. If we allow our soldiers to be attacked without retribution, it will be seen as weakness.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You may have a point.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: I do? I mean, yeah, I do! Now come on, let's go get Ranger. Look at us working together, just like the old days!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Quiet, you'll give us away! Just like the old days.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Careful, that's a patrol.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: There he is, the glorious "Bright Lord!" I knew that little sniveling crapper would manage to get you here!

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Brûz! I'll show you sniveling... what have you done with Ranger?

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Shut your trap! This is between me and the Gravewalker!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then come down here. And we'll end this.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Nah, nah. This is just the beginning. First. It has to hurt. Then, if one of my boys kills you or that sniveling rat, so much the better! But if they don't, well, that's when the real fun starts, doesn't it?
[Talion kills the ambushers.]

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Brûz! Come back here you rotten piece of Shrakh!

Speaker: Talion
Text: He's gone, but we'll see him again.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: We'd better, because I'm not done with him!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Listen to me. We will find Ranger. And we'll take care of Brûz once and for all.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Well, I'm not just going to sit on my arse and wait. I will scour every inch of Mordor until I find him. And when I do -- You will be the first to know.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Fair enough.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Brûz is just the beginning. The more power we gain, the more others will seek to challenge it.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we'll kill them.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: No, he must be made an example of. or others will rise to take his place.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we kill them as well.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Why kill countless challengers when you can stop it all by breaking one?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Because we are here to win a war, and not play your politics.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: In Mordor they are one and the same.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Rise! They rise. Archers of Morgoth, let fly. Arise in haste. Archers are raised by acolytes of Zog.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Who are these Archers of Morgoth?

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Morgoth was the first Dark Lord and these Archers, long dead, were one of his creations. they were masters of their craft and cannot be allowed to escape these caves.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: There they be.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We must destroy their totems before more of them rise.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Their arrows sing. I bleed! I bleed! Flee their bolts and barbs! Flee!

Speaker: Archer of Morgoth
Text: Join us, dead man. We celebrate your darkness!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: To dust the archers go and Morgoth be damned. Find Zog and his acolytes, Deathless One. Cleanse them with fire and spare not a one.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger, we have to act quickly! Follow me!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Let me guess, you received another message from Brûz.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Aye, and you're not going to like what he had to say. Brûz snatched up some of your boys and poisoned them. He wants you to know that if you don't move, fast, they'll diel

Speaker: Talion
Text: He needs to be stopped.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: While you sort this mess out, I'll get back to tracking Brûz. Heh. Ratbag and Gravewalker. We make quite a team! You're ignoring me, aren't you? Is it because I said Ratbag first? How about the Gravewalker and Ratbag? Better?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Okay, this is the place. You go do your thing and I'll go do my equally important and heroic thing.
[Talion rescues his followers.]
I've been expecting you. Brûz wants me to make you and your boys suffer. He didn't have to ask twice.

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: So that's it? That's why Brûz is so sore over the Tark?

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: Right, suppose you had to be there.

Brûz was a legend before he met you, undefeated in battle! You took that away from him! You’re going to lose everything you've worked so hard to build. Brûz will tear it down! Are you having fun yet? Brûz wanted me to keep you and your foolish followers entertained!

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: I hear Brûz killed the Gravewalker. Stabbed him right in the heart.

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: That's a load of shrakh. If he killed the Gravewalker then whose Men are we guarding?

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: I never thought about that. Now that is confusing.
Brûz is going to take his time with you. He's going to make you regret you ever crossed him!
[Now Talion needs to defeat Brûz’s followers. He brands their Captain.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Tremble before me! Join my army!

Speaker: Hoshgrish the Plan-Maker
Text: I will be your chosen. I'll keep your guts safe!

Speaker: Talion
Text: I think I've had enough of Brûz and his antics.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You know what must be done. Death will not suffice. Make an example of him so that he will serve as a warning to all who would follow his lead.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: The brothers of corruption raise their dead. Haste. Haste.
[Talion mounts Carnán.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: The stench of death surrounds. A confusion of ghuls they rise and rise.

Speaker: Talion
Text: As they rise, so shall they fall.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Brood rages. Brood screams!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion, we must destroy the ghûl mounds. Only then will they stop. Talion, we must dismount.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: The ritual deatens them, angers them. End the ritual.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We won't be able to end the ritual if we don't get through these ghûls.

Speaker: Orc
Text: Destroy one totem and we will raise a hundred more!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Drawn to its energy, the caragors. Driven by its corruption!
[Talion purifies the totem.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Our work continues, Deathless One. Be ready.
[Talion goes back to destroyed Minas Ithil.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Dark magics infested the very bones of the city.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: It is no longer Minas Ithil. It is now Minas Morgul.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: I tracked one of the Ringwraiths here after we drove him from Shelob's cave.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Came to lick his wounds. All we did was chase him off. Be on your guard.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Your ability to track the Nazgûl... another gift from Galadriel?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: A gift... That is one way to put it.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We are here for the Palantir. That is all that matters.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then we will have to fight our way to it. The city is crawling with Orcs.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: They need not be obstacles. We can turn them into valuable assets.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The Nine will stop at nothing to seize that ring.

Speaker: Talion
Text: This ring is not their prize, it is their destruction.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The Ringwraiths cannot be destroyed. They always come back.

Speaker: Talion
Text: But you don't stop fighting.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: No. Not ever.

Speaker: Talion
Text: To destroy the Nazgûl forever... there must be a way

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: If there is, I have not yet found it. Stay by my side, Ranger, and I will show you what a Ringwraith is.
[Suddenly a Nazgûl enters the battlefield.]

Speaker: Suladân
Text: The Witch-king has taken possession of this city. Now he will take possession of you!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Talion! The Light of Galadriel will shield us!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: His dark power is no match for the Light of Galadriel!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Talion! Don't let him catch you outside the light!

Speaker: Suladân
Text: A special fate awaits the Ringmaker! I will annihilate your entire army!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: To me, Talion! The Light of Eärendil defends us!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The Light of Galadriel is greater than his foul magic!

Speaker: Suladân
Text: That Ring belongs to Sauron! You cannot defeat the Nine! You will join them!

[Talions brands him and sees events from Suladân’s past. He, as human king, comes with his army to the smith where Sauron and Celebrimbor forge rings of power. Sauron offers Suladân a ring that poisons his mind.]

Speaker: Guard Captain
Text: What has been done to you?
[Sauron whispers something in Suladân’s ear.]

Speaker: Suladân
Text: Kneel before your King.
[The soldiers kneels. The vision ends.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Were you granted vision?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Then you understand. These were once great men. But they could not resist a Ring of Power--

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Sauron's Rings were designed to subjugate their wearers. I realized that too late. But now I have crafted a Ring that is perfect. This one is pure.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Pure what, I wonder.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger! I mean, Gravewalker! Or should that be Bright Lord? How many names do you have? Never mind. I saw Ranger. MY Ranger!

Speaker: Talion
Text: You're sure you saw him?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: With my own eyes. I'd have gone into that cave and saved him myself but he's probably very heavily guarded.

Speaker: Talion
Text: If you found him, then it means Brûz wanted you to. It's another trap.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: You don't think much of me, do you.
[Talion follows Ratbag… to the trap.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Oi! What's wrong with you? You've got an army to raise and a war to win! But here you are wasting time trying to rescue a brainless shrakh! Well, you had better be quick, because a pack of my caragors woke up in a foul mood this morning so I decided to cut them loose. They haven't eaten in days! (runs away]

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: You have to save Ranger! I'll stay out here in case Brûz doubles back!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: You should know that I've been a little rough with the big oaf. I figure at this point the pain of those caragors tearing him apart will be a relief!

Speaker: Talion
Text: That's definitely not Ranger.
[It explodes.]

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Of course it's not Ranger! Did you really think I was done toying with your Not even close!

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Run!

Speaker: Orc
Text: Made it out alive, did ya? Well, we'll fix that.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Was it a trap? I saw Brûz double back and then I heard a bunch or explosions and then you killed a bunch of… oh right. It was a trap. But no worries, saw where he went. I’ll track him down!
[Nazgûl approaches the fortress of Talion.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Helm Hammerhand. Of all the Nazgûl, his fall was most tragic. His rage knows no bounds.

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: The Dark Lord will have his prize, Ranger of Gondor. That fortress is a tiny island surrounded by a sea of darkness. And the tide rises against you!
[He summons thousands of ghûls.]

Speaker: Tûgog Graug Catcher
Text: You take the Shrieker, I'll get his pets!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You hold this fort for the Bright Lord. You will not falter!

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: You cannot win. The armies of the Dark Lord, like his powers, are limitless!
[He turns into some kind of wyvern.]

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: You are brave, Ranger. Your will is as strong as your fortress walls. The Witch-king will add you to his army!

Speaker: Talion
Text: He will need someone to replace you.

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: We will strike you down forever until you submit to him!
[Nazgûl is practically hammering Talion to the dust.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: You will not claim him!
[She strikes off a blow and blinds him with the Light of Galadriel. Nazgûl runs away.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: His wounds will slow him. What about yours?

Speaker: Talion
Text: This Nazgûl was injured… we have the advantage.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Hammerhand was known for his strength in life, If anything he has grown more powerful in death.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: I'm making a habit of saving you.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I think I prefer the version where you don't impale me.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Where is the Nazgûl?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Nearby. Can you keep up?

Speaker: Talion
Text: I’ll do my best. That was not the first time you faced Helm, was it?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: I have faced each Ringwraith more times than I can count.

Speaker: Talion
Text: And you've never defeated them.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Not yet.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then why do you keep fighting?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: In the war against darkness, sometimes stalemate is victory.

Speaker: Talion
Text: For now, the battle must be won.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Of all Helm's servants, the drakes are most dangerous

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: If we could dominate one, we could turn the weapon of the enemy against him.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Like a Ring of power? You do nothing to dispel my fears, Elf Lord.

Speaker: Talion
Text: What happens to the Nazgûl when they are defeated?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Their spirit endures. It returns to Barad-dûr, growing in strength until it can again take physical form.

Speaker: Talion
Text: So. They are banished from death.
[The Nazgûl appears again.]

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: My master commands that you serve him... But your she-Elf friend. I will take her head and hands as trophies! I have felled better beasts than you! Smarter, faster, stronger! You are game! Prey! Nothing more! Feel the hot fire of my drakes, the cold steel of my hammer! I have hunted every beast in Middle-earth. And none has ever escaped me! Fall to your knees and await the final stroke! You will bleed, every drop wakening you!
[Talion brands him.]

Speaker: Helm Hammerhand
Text: You cannot hide from the huntsman! My torment ends-- and yours is simply beginning!
[We see a vision from the Nazgûl’s past. He was shot in a forest and his daughter taken.]

Speaker: Siric
Text: You should have given me your daughter's hand when I asked.
[We're teleporting to Helm’s Castle where he lies on his deathbed. Sauron and Celebrimbor approach him.]

Speaker: Annatar
Text: For your daughter's safe return... (put a ring on his finger]
[Helm is getting his strength back. He puts on his armor and goes to save his daughter.]

Speaker: Bernwyn - Helm’s Daughter
Text: Please don't fight him.

Speaker: Siric
Text: If you kill me, you'll start a war.

Speaker: Helm
Text: War has come.
[He kills his daughter and every soldier in the room.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: My lord!
[The vision ends.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: You… How could you? You stood beside Sauron as he gave these kings the very rings chac doomed them.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Those rings were meant to bring order. Sauron deceived me. He deceived us all.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Knowing what you know now, still you crafted a new ring…

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: WE crafted a ring. Why else did you pick up my hammer? It is not noble Men we are dominating, but savage Orcs. And it is with this army that all Sauron has wrought will be undone.

Speaker: Talion
Text: No matter the cost.
[He leaves.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A drake would have been a great asset.
[Eltariel leaves too. Tallion collects all the web pieces and reveal Shelob’s story. She sees a lot of soldiers approaching their castle.]

Speaker: Shelob
Text: We must stand against them. Destroy them!

Speaker: Annatar
Text: They will only keep coming. Sacrifices must be made.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: You would abandon me?

Speaker: Annatar
Text: Sacrifices must be made.
[She kills soldiers and crawls into a cave where she turns into a giant spider.]

Speaker: Shelob
Text: The Great Deceiver will pay for his betrayal. He will suffer. He will suffer. He will--

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger! I found Ranger! And I found Brûz!

Speaker: Talion
Text: This all feels very familiar. Will this Ranger explode like the last one?

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: No. Ratbag is sure this time! While you was off racing into a trap -- good job by the way -- I tracked down Brûz. The ugly shrakh never saw me! He's got my Ranger, the real one!

Speaker: Talion
Text: I'll handle this. Just keep out of sight. I don't want any more surprises.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Right, splendid. We'll do it your way. No faffing about.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Brûz doesn't expect us. We should strike now.

Speaker: Talion
Text: First, we save Ranger.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Ranger is expendable. Our priority should be making an example of Brûz.

Speaker: Talion
Text: He will be dealt with, but we have to make sure Ranger is safe.
[He finds chained Ranger.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: It's all right... it's all right. Easy. Easy. (cut his chains]

Speaker: Ranger
Text: Figures Ratbag would come to you for help. What took you so long?

Speaker: Talion
Text: Can you walk?

Speaker: Ranger
Text: I was tortured. I was starved, but yes, I can walk. And if we're going after Brûz, I can run.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I'll take that as a yes.

Speaker: Ranger
Text: It is time to make Brûz pay for what he's done.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I take it you're ready to end this. That makes two of us.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Now, to make an example of Brûz.

Speaker: Talion
Text: An example all of Mordor will remember.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Oi! What the bloody blazes are you doing here? And who said you could let Ranger out of his cage?!

Speaker: Ranger
Text: Who are you talking to? Is the Gravewalker insane? Fine. Just ignore my question.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The two of us are going to teach you a lesson.

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: You trying to hurt me? Ha! I'd like to see you try! That don't hurt! That's not gonna work! Didn't feel a thing! Gonna have to do better than that!
[Talion defeats Brûz.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: On your knees!

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: Enough, kill me! Just end it.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: No.
[He shames Brûz, however, it isn’t shown how exactly.]

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Ranger! C'mere ya big glob, you!

Speaker: Ranger
Text: I see you weren't tough enough to save me yourself.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: It’s good to see you too!

Speaker: Ranger
Text: You’re an idiot. Learn some Black Speech. You embarrass me.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: It’s almost like he’s talking. Thank you Ranger. Ah, Gravewalker. Thank you, Bright Lord. We are even--

Speaker: Brûz the Chopper
Text: I don't want the fort… I don't want the fort! I never wanted the fort!

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Is that Brûz… you broke him. I'd rather die than live like that.

Speaker: Talion
Text: That's the point.

Speaker: Ratbag
Text: Come on Ranger, let's get out of here. This is giving me the creeps.

Speaker: Ranger
Text: You're a cruel one, Gravewalker.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Now every Orc in Mordor will think twice before challenging us.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Whenever I find you, I know the Nazgûl must be close,

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: As long as you wear that Ring, they will be closer than you like.

Speaker: Talion
Text: For now, I have no choice. How many Nazgûl are there?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Just one.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Isildur.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The King who cut the One Ring from Sauron's hand…

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: And wore it on his own. This is the legacy of your rings, Celebrimbor.
[Isildur summons 5 soldiers and disappears.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: These Men died in Minas Ithil...

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: These are no longer men! Do not hesitate! The only mercy for them is death!
[Talion kills them.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Raising his enemies, denying them rest. turning them against their brothers... is there no foul stratagem the Witch-king will not employ?

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: There are bound to be many more... It's best they don't see us coming.

Speaker: Isildur
Text: Your armies become mine! They were your comrades -- now they are my slaves!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Return to your rest!

Speaker: Isildur
Text: Tremble as your friends turn against you! In ages past, I commanded armies of Men, and now they will again follow me!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Come, Talion, Isildur must be nearby!

Speaker: Isildur
Text: You will submit to the Witch-king... and at our sides, you will serve him. Or you will die... and I will raise you as my puppet. You have a choice before you.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You don't.

Speaker: Isildur
Text: All Men will perish and serve me! The Dark Lord's gaze is fire! You will share my torment - brother! You cannot prevail, foolish Ranger! My army is tireless. My army is infinite! All who resist will burn!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The light of Eӓrendil will protect us!
[She creates a light barrier. Isildur walks around him, lazily waving his sword.]

Speaker: Isildur
Text: You still do not understand -- but you will be made to. All who are called will serve the Dark Lord. There is no escape -- even in death!
[The ghost of Castamir, who was in command of Minas Ithil, appears.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: Castamir.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He serves the Dark Lord still.

Speaker: Castamir
Text: Minas... Ithil... Morgul! Open… city! Save... Idril...Minas Ithil... The city... Witch-king... Palantir… At all costs, at all… all costs...
[Talion releases him.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Isildur will rise more of Gondor’s fallen. I will track him. You and I will meet again.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Well as long as I wear this Ring, I'm sure that's true.
[The forest is in flames.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: They come for Carnán.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must destroy their totems.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: These magics poison the forest, they poison Carnán.

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: He defiles the ritual!

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: We've found the Great Tree! All torchbearers to the clearing!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Fouled is the air! Devoured by flame!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must return to Carnán NOW!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Flesh will feed the forest! Flesh for tree and brood. Come! Meet your end. Flame will devour your bones as mine! Come! The Spirit of Carnán will deliver death to all. Come, come!
[Talion kill all Orcs in the forest and purify their totems.]

Speaker: Carnán
Text: It is done. Come. Come, deathless one. All is burn-ed. Choke-ed.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: The forest has been cleared. They will not be back.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Curse-ed is Zog by furious hunger. A pact unfinished he will raise Tar Goroth.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Tar Goroth is no more. You saw to that.

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Put ear to earth and heed. Brothers of corruption hold gloaming vigil. Fire will rise from ice.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: If Zog is able to raise the Balrog, it will be his thrall, and its power will be his. He must be stopped.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You're not coming with us, are you?

Speaker: Carnán
Text: The long winter calls my name.

Speaker: Talion
Text: But how? How could ..

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Forests of Carnán must rest in dwell. Carnán be still or all is ash. The circle cannot be broken. Go now.
[Talion travels to the lake where Tar Goroth was defeated the last time. There are four totems around the crack in the ice where he fell.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: The ritual has commenced.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We can waste no time.

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Tar Goroth! We call you back from your tomb. Rise and join our glory. It's working! Tar Goroth lives! It lives! You will not foul che ritual! Tar Goroth will rise, but not for Sauron. He will fight in MY army. A legion of the dead that will rival any army of Mordor! You will hear them when they come for they will chant my name: ZOG! ZOG! ZOG!

Speaker: Talion
Text: You don't deserve this life!

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Your body will be burned and scattered to the winds, Gravewalker! He destroys the totems!

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: Stop him! Mordor belongs to Zog!

Speaker: Orc 2
Text: Stop him before he ends the ritual!

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Tar Goroth rises! He rises! The horror, the horror!
[Talion purify all 4 totems.]

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: No. No. Nooooo! You will pay!

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Dimwit! I was about to pull life from death and you ended it! He was to be my masterwork and you ended it! This is how you die, Gravewalker!

Speaker: Orc 1
Text: Tar Goroth rises to the surface.

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Too slow, dead man. I will snatch this life and every other from you. Uh uh uh! You're the only thing in my way now. You are ended! Die! Die! Die! You will join Tar Goroth in the depths. The ritual cannot be ended!
[Despite the increased resistance, Talion is able to defeat Zog.]

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: You've done it. You killed me. But let me tell you a secret: Necromancers never truly die. (maniacally laughs]
[Talion decapitates Zog.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: I think we did it.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Then Carnán's sacrifice was not in vain.
[Orcs necromancers revive Zog.]

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: By your craft, I am reborn, brothers! Look around you: the Orcs who took this city. This is OUR army. Not Sauron's. Not the Witch-king's. The dominion of those slave masters is at an end, for today. WE RISE!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Zog's acolytes have been busy.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: A necromancer is never truly dead.

Speaker: Talion
Text: The arena is stocked with dead Uruk, victims of the siege.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: An army in waiting.

Speaker: Ashgarn the Tark Slayer
Text: I will drain YOU, filth!
[Talion kills resurrected Captains and purify totems.]

Speaker: Orc Necromancer
Text: Stop him before he ends the ritual! He has drained our totem!

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Dimwit! You understand now, don't you. The dead aren't dead. They're just waiting for someone who will listen, who will answer their call. Once you're out of the way, we will all rise again. We've been here before. How many lives do you think I have left? We could have been allies! We share a common enemy, Ranger!
[Talion kills Zog again.]

Speaker: Zog the Eternal
Text: Kill me, Ranger. I will wait among the dead. Then we will all rise together.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: It is Carnán!

Speaker: Carnán
Text: Cleansed by fire to ash you go. Burn to cinder and never to return. I told you, Ranger: Undeath will defeat undeath.

Speaker: ACT III
Text: SHADOW AND FLAME

Speaker: Talion
Text: Our forces are ready.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And Sauron awaits.

Speaker: Isildur
Text: Talion. This is your fate.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Isildur awaits.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We bring this war to them.
[He's giving a speech in front of his army.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: We have conquered the forts of Mordor. But it is still not ours. Sauron's army advances, ready to butcher every last one of us. But we will not die under his rule. We do not serve the Dark Lord. We will sally forth on the battlefield! And take this land for our own! You fight for Mordor. You fight for the Bright Lord! Charge!
[He jumps off the Black Gate and the epic battle with Sauron’s Army begins.]

Speaker: Az-Gang the Tailor
Text: Silky! Our final confrontation on the final battlefield. You will never get past me.

Speaker: Mozû Ranger-Killer
Text: That's enough threats. Let's make good on ‘em!

Speaker: Orc
Text: You fight for the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Eltariel! Support the Orcs!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Never thought I’d hear that!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Push on!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Nan iChir Gelair! [I am the Bright Lord!] Join the army of the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Az-Gang the Tailor
Text: My mind is free.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: I scorn you.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Your army fights well! For Orcs.

Speaker: Talion
Text: They get the job done. In their own way.

Speaker: Hûra the Panderer
Text: Sugarflesh! Ignore the pain and come to me, Ranger. I have the sweet release of death you so desperately crave.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Eltariel! We must push through.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: I'm pushing. You worry about your Orcs! Sauron’s throwing hos entire army on us!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then he will lose it all!

Speaker: Krimp Evil Eye
Text: I see you! This stops now. You may have defeated the others, but you will not defeat me. This has been a long time coming.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Onward!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will obey!

Speaker: Orc
Text: I fight for you!

Speaker: Isildur
Text: Your time has come, Talion. All that you have wrought has led you here. We are bound together in this brotherhood. This is the fate of kings and men.

Speaker: Talion
Text: It shall not be mine.
[They take out their swords and fight each other.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: For the Galadhrim.

Speaker: Isildur
Text: You died and he brought you back. You know, you know. The Dark Lord will remake you. We will devour Middle-earth. I died and he brought me back. Brought me back to this.
[Talion brands Isildur and sees the beginning of Peter Jackson's first film.]

Speaker: Isildur
Text: I am the lord of the ring.
[The body of the murdered Isildur is being taken to Barad-dûr.]

Speaker: Annatar
Text: You will serve me for all eternity.
[Sauron puts his ring to Isildur’s finger. Isildur awakes. The vision ends.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You are mine.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I cannot allow this. Isildur, I release you.
[He pierces Isildur with his sword.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Talion no!

Speaker: Talion
Text: Find peace in death.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: He was not yours to release!

Speaker: Talion
Text: And he was not yours to enslave.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: He did more than that. You broke Sauron's hold. You dominated him.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: And I will dominate Sauron. His armies will be mine.

Speaker: Talion
Text: We are meant to destroy Sauron.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: Sauron cannot be destroyed.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Celebrimbor is right. We fight and fight but evil always returns. Talion, we can end this here.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: We must ensure Mordor is restored to light, not darkness.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I will not trade one Dark Lord for another.This is not the end I have fought for.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: But you are not the only one fighting.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: No. He is not. This is not about your petty vengeance. Or mine. This is about restoring order to Mordor. To all of Middle-earth. The end you fought for? You are but a vessel. And there are others. The Lady Galadriel sent you here for a reason. Together we can bring Sauron to his knees we can finish what our people started so long ago.
[He's reaching out to her. There’s a ring in his hand. She looks at Talion and takes the ring. Talion starts to bleed and fall to the ground.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Our sacrifices are not in vain. This is the only way.
[Celebrimbor looks at him and disappears. A few spiders crawl up to Talion's dead body…]

Speaker: Talion
Text: See the future you have wrought. A Bright Lord instead of a dark one.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: You pitiful Man. I gave you sight and yet you still do not see.

Speaker: Talion
Text: You showed me a fate I could not change!

Speaker: Shelob
Text: You are wrong. When you and Celebrimbor forged a new Ring of Power, I saw where your path ended. Locked in battle against Sauron at the top of Barad-dûr.... and you won. Sauron was enslaved and the Bright Lord rose in his place. The armies of Mordor marched forth under his banner and Middle-earth fell under his heel. That is the future I fought against. The future you prevented. Because you saw Celebrimbor for what he was.

Speaker: Talion
Text: No.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Your war is not yet ended. Talion. Whether a Bright Lord or a Dark Lord rules Barad-dûr, the balance of power must be maintained or all of Middle-earth will fall.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Minas Morgul.

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Yes. From there. Mordor can be held back.

Speaker: Talion
Text: How? The ring is gone.

Speaker: I asked you once
Text: how much are you willing to sacrifice? Open your eyes, Talion. Open your eyes.
[Talion's waking up. It stretches to Isildur's ring... and picks it up.]

Speaker: Talion
Text: As long as I have breath in my body, my fate is my own...
[He puts the ring to his finger. The screen fades. Having put on the hood and ink on his eyes, he goes to Minas Morgul.]

Speaker: Orc
Text: You must have rocks in your head. This is Minas Morgul and you are one man.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I am one. But we are many.
[A whole army of dead men appears behind his back. It’s time to capture Minas Morgul.]

Speaker: Nazgûl’s Voice
Text: Your day has come, Gravewalker. Give in! You will forget your pain. Your life. You will serve alongside us! The world of Men will fall! He will feed on you. Serve the Witch-king for eternity!
[He opens the door to the room with Palantir.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: Join us, brother.

Speaker: Talion
Text: I am not of darkness yet. And I am not your brother.

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: You will know true deathlessness. My armies. The Dark Lord will claim his prize. You will become one of the faceless. Your name will be wiped away. Your history. I am nothing. I am darkness. Minas Morgul will never fall. My ally! Isildur is gone. You will join the Nine. He will feed on you. You freed Isildur, but you will take his place. You will serve the Witch-king! You will become like me. One of the hollow men. Your day has come, Gravewalker. Forget the past. Forget their faces. The past is past. Join us.
[Talion manages to defeat one of the strongest warriors of Middle-Earth.]

Speaker: Witch-king
Text: You cannot see inside me. Nothing of my soul remains.

Speaker: Talion
Text: Then I banish you. Minas Morgul is mine.

[Witch-king disappears. Talion takes the Palantir in his hands and sees the Dark Tower without The Eye on it. Meanwhile, Eltariel/Celebrimbor enters Sauron’s chambers. The Dark Lord greets them himself.]

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will serve the Bright Lord now.
[Sauron takes off his battle gear.]

Speaker: Annatar
Text: In the body of Elf or Man, you are unchanged, Celebrimbor.
[Epic fight begins.]

Speaker: Annatar
Text: You lost the Ranger. That was a mistake.

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: We have never felt such power.

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: This is the power of the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Cower before the light of Galadriel!

Speaker: Annatar
Text: You will fail here, Celebrimbor. Curse you!
[Annatar turns on his armor.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Witness the might of the Galadhrim!

Speaker: Sauron
Text: Pretender!

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: The forces of Darkness cannot harm me! Fear me and despair!

Speaker: Sauron
Text: You are alone in the darkness!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will submit to me.

Speaker: Sauron
Text: You are but a minion!
[Eltariel uses the Light of Galadriel.]

Speaker: Blade of Galadriel
Text: Now!

Speaker: Celebrimbor
Text: You will serve the Bright Lord!

Speaker: Annatar
Text: I serve no one! You will be devoured, Bright Lord.

[Celebrimbor almost manages to brand Annatar when he suddenly takes out a dagger and cuts off his fingers along with the ring -- Eltariel’s fingers to be exact. Annatar and Celebrimbor hugs and unite. Talion been watching everything through Palantir.]

Speaker: Shelob
Text: Sauron and Celebrimbor became one. Locked in a prison of perpetual war -- a Flaming Eye casting its shadow over Mordor. Talion had retaken in the city of Minas Morgul, but his war was far from over. His greatest battle will be fought against the shadow within himself and the tower to the east. To hold back the Darkness. To save the world of Men.
